intro: Pilea parietaria var. yunquensis, commonly known as the Yunquensis Stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that emerge from the center of the rosette. It thrives in rocky or crevice habitats, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage is typically succulent, with a waxy texture that helps it retain moisture in arid conditions.
